message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CL. 

The paper deals with video understanding and action recognition, which are primarily computer vision tasks, hence cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a fully-connected temporal CRF model that involves deep learning, which makes cs.LG and cs.AI likely sub-categories as well. The paper also mentions the Charades benchmark, which is a popular benchmark for action recognition in videos, indicating that the paper is related to multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper discusses the challenge of constructing mini-batches for end-to-end training, which is a common issue in natural language processing (NLP) as well, making cs.CL a possible sub-category.
